result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Appointing Counsel, filed Daniel Gutierrez
Hearing on July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:15 AM Defendant Ian M Hall in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ronald Sonderhouse appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant not to physically discipline any children.    Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victims A-B/witnesses A-C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day.

10:14 AM Defendant Ian M Hall in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter or the Defendant does not report to WCS, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
